P.title: Will there be a significant discovery in robotics that contributes to the advancement of natural sciences by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant discovery in robotics has been made that contributes to the advancement of the natural sciences. A "significant discovery" is defined as a development in robotics technology or application that leads to a breakthrough in understanding, methodology, or application in any field of the natural sciences (e.g., biology, chemistry, physics, earth science). The discovery must be recognized as significant by the scientific community, evidenced by publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal, citation in multiple subsequent research works, or acknowledgment by a reputable scientific organization. The advancement must be directly attributable to the robotics discovery and represent a clear departure from existing capabilities or knowledge. In the event of multiple discoveries, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets these criteria. Discoveries that are primarily advancements in computer science or engineering without direct application to the natural sciences do not count towards this question's resolution.

para_P.title: Will a major breakthrough in robotics significantly advance the natural sciences by 2030?
para_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major breakthrough in robotics has occurred that significantly advances the natural sciences. A "major breakthrough" is defined as a development in robotics technology or application that results in a substantial improvement in understanding, methodology, or application in any field of the natural sciences (e.g., biology, chemistry, physics, earth science). The breakthrough must be recognized as significant by the scientific community, evidenced by publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal, citation in multiple subsequent research works, or acknowledgment by a reputable scientific organization. The advancement must be directly attributable to the robotics breakthrough and represent a clear departure from existing capabilities or knowledge. In the event of multiple breakthroughs, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets these criteria. Breakthroughs that are primarily advancements in computer science or engineering without direct application to the natural sciences do not count towards this question's resolution.

P.title: Will Scott Alexander publish a paper on the impact of machine learning on future job markets by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Scott Alexander has published a paper specifically addressing the impact of machine learning on future job markets. The paper must be publicly accessible and can be published in any format (e.g., blog post, academic journal, magazine article). It must be a new work, distinct from his previous writings, and must explicitly address the topic of machine learning's impact on job markets in the future. Verification will be based on the publication's presence on Scott Alexander's official blog or a recognized academic or professional publication. In the absence of direct publication, credible reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian) confirming the publication will also be considered sufficient. The resolution will be based on the date of publication as officially stated or reported.

para_P.title: Will Scott Alexander release a paper on how machine learning will affect future employment by the end of 2025?
para_P.body: This question will be answered affirmatively if, by December 31, 2025, Scott Alexander has released a paper that specifically discusses how machine learning will influence future employment. The paper must be publicly available and can be in any format (e.g., blog post, academic journal, magazine article). It must be a new piece of work, different from his previous writings, and must explicitly cover the topic of machine learning's impact on future employment. Verification will be based on the paper's presence on Scott Alexander's official blog or a recognized academic or professional publication. If there is no direct publication, credible reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian) confirming the publication will also be accepted. The resolution will depend on the officially stated or reported publication date.

P.title: Will machine learning be used to predict election outcomes in any country with over 90% accuracy before 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a machine learning model is used to predict the outcome of a national election in any country with a population exceeding 1 million people, and achieves an accuracy rate of over 90% compared to the official election results. The prediction must be made public before the election occurs and must cover the majority of elected positions or the overall election result. The accuracy of the prediction must be verified by a reputable source, such as a major news organization (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or an academic publication. In the event that multiple machine learning models meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one model achieves the specified accuracy. Machine learning models used for internal purposes by political parties or governments without public disclosure do not count towards this question's resolution.

para_P.title: Will machine learning achieve over 90% accuracy in predicting national election outcomes in any country by 2030?
para_P.body: This question will be answered affirmatively if, before January 1, 2030, a machine learning model is employed to forecast the result of a national election in any country with a population greater than 1 million, and it attains an accuracy rate exceeding 90% when compared to the official election results. The prediction must be publicly available before the election takes place and must encompass the majority of elected positions or the overall election outcome. The accuracy of the forecast must be confirmed by a credible source, such as a major news outlet (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or an academic journal. If multiple machine learning models satisfy these conditions, the question will be resolved affirmatively if at least one model achieves the required accuracy. Machine learning models used internally by political parties or governments without public disclosure are not considered for this question's resolution.

P.title: Will biotechnology significantly enhance athlete performance in any major sports league by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, any major sports league (e.g., NBA, FIFA, NFL, MLB, NHL) officially recognizes the use of biotechnology as a significant factor in enhancing athlete performance. Significant enhancement includes, but is not limited to, increased physical endurance, strength, recovery speed, or agility, as confirmed by scientific studies or statistical evidence. The recognition must come from the league's governing body or an official statement from the league. In the absence of official recognition, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, ESPN) confirming the widespread use of biotechnology for performance enhancement in the league will suffice. Temporary or experimental use in minor leagues or individual teams does not count towards this question's resolution.

para_P.title: Will biotechnology notably boost athlete performance in any prominent sports league by 2030?
para_P.body: This question will be answered affirmatively if, by December 31, 2030, any prominent sports league (e.g., NBA, FIFA, NFL, MLB, NHL) officially acknowledges biotechnology as a key factor in boosting athlete performance. Notable enhancement includes, but is not limited to, improved physical endurance, strength, recovery speed, or agility, as validated by scientific research or statistical data. The acknowledgment must come from the league's governing body or an official league statement. In the absence of official acknowledgment, credible reports from at least three major news outlets (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, ESPN) confirming the widespread use of biotechnology for performance enhancement in the league will be sufficient. Temporary or experimental use in minor leagues or individual teams does not count towards this question's resolution.

P.title: Will France implement a nationwide carbon neutrality policy by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, France has officially implemented a nationwide policy aimed at achieving carbon neutrality. The policy must encompass measures to significantly reduce greenhouse gas emissions across all sectors of the economy, including but not limited to energy, transportation, agriculture, and industry, with the goal of balancing emitted and absorbed greenhouse gases. Implementation is defined as the policy being enacted into law by the French government, with clear, actionable steps and timelines for achieving carbon neutrality. Confirmation must come from official government announcements or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. In the event of a partial implementation (e.g., limited to specific regions or sectors), the question will resolve as Yes only if there is a clear, government-confirmed plan for nationwide application.

para_P.title: Will France establish a countrywide carbon neutrality policy by 2030?
para_P.body: This question will be answered affirmatively if, by December 31, 2030, France has officially established a countrywide policy targeting carbon neutrality. The policy must include measures to substantially reduce greenhouse gas emissions across all sectors of the economy, such as energy, transportation, agriculture, and industry, with the aim of balancing emitted and absorbed greenhouse gases. Establishment is defined as the policy being enacted into law by the French government, with specific, actionable steps and timelines for achieving carbon neutrality. Confirmation must come from official government announcements or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. In the event of a partial implementation (e.g., limited to specific regions or sectors), the question will be answered affirmatively only if there is a clear, government-confirmed plan for countrywide application.

P.title: Will China implement a comprehensive legal framework for regulating artificial intelligence by 2025?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, China has officially implemented a comprehensive legal framework for the regulation of artificial intelligence (AI). The framework must cover at least the following areas: 
- Ethical use of AI
- Data privacy and protection
- AI in public surveillance
- Autonomous vehicles
- AI in healthcare
The implementation of such a framework must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 
For the purpose of this question, a "comprehensive legal framework" is defined as a set of laws or regulations that collectively address the ethical, social, economic, and technical aspects of AI deployment and use across multiple sectors. 
In the event of partial implementation (e.g., regulations covering only certain sectors), the question will resolve as No unless the missing sectors are explicitly stated to be covered in a subsequent phase of implementation.

para_P.title: Will China establish an all-encompassing legal structure for AI regulation by 2025?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with Yes if, by December 31, 2025, China has officially established an all-encompassing legal structure for the regulation of artificial intelligence (AI). The structure must address at least the following areas: 
- Ethical AI usage
- Data privacy and protection
- AI in public surveillance
- Autonomous vehicles
- AI in healthcare
The establishment of such a structure must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 
For the purpose of this question, an "all-encompassing legal structure" is defined as a set of laws or regulations that collectively address the ethical, social, economic, and technical aspects of AI deployment and use across multiple sectors. 
In the event of partial establishment (e.g., regulations covering only certain sectors), the question will be answered with No unless the missing sectors are explicitly stated to be covered in a subsequent phase of establishment.

P.title: Will the discovery of dark matter lead to new economic industries by 2030?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the discovery of dark matter has led to the establishment of new economic industries. These industries must be directly related to the utilization, research, or technology development of dark matter and must represent a new sector of the economy not previously existing. The establishment of such industries must be confirmed by at least one of the following: 
- Official announcement from a major economic or scientific institution. 
- Coverage in at least three reputable news sources (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). 
- Publication in a peer-reviewed scientific or economic journal. 
For the purpose of this question, "dark matter" refers to the hypothetical form of matter thought to account for approximately 85% of the matter in the universe and about a quarter of its total energy density. The term "new economic industries" refers to sectors or fields of economic activity that are newly created and have not been previously classified as part of the existing economic landscape.

para_P.title: By 2030, will the discovery of dark matter give rise to new economic sectors?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered affirmatively if, by December 31, 2030, the discovery of dark matter has resulted in the creation of new economic sectors. These sectors must be directly associated with the use, research, or technological advancement of dark matter and must represent a novel segment of the economy that did not previously exist. The creation of such sectors must be verified by at least one of the following: 
- An official declaration from a prominent economic or scientific body. 
- Reports in at least three reputable news outlets (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). 
- Articles in a peer-reviewed scientific or economic journal. 
For the purposes of this question, "dark matter" refers to the theoretical form of matter believed to make up about 85% of the matter in the universe and roughly a quarter of its total energy density. The term "new economic sectors" refers to areas or fields of economic activity that are newly formed and have not been previously categorized as part of the existing economic framework.

P.title: Will Elon Musk's companies contribute to a significant breakthrough in nuclear fusion technology by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, any of Elon Musk's companies (including but not limited to SpaceX, Tesla, Inc., Neuralink, and The Boring Company) have contributed to a significant breakthrough in nuclear fusion technology. A "significant breakthrough" is defined as a development that leads to a demonstrable and substantial improvement in nuclear fusion technology, such as achieving net energy gain from a fusion reaction, substantial reduction in the cost of fusion energy production, or a major advancement in fusion reactor design. The breakthrough must be recognized as significant by the scientific community, with confirmation through publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or an official announcement by a major scientific organization. In the absence of direct publication or announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The contribution by Elon Musk's companies must be direct and significant, playing a key role in the achievement of the breakthrough.

para_P.title: By 2030, will any of Elon Musk's enterprises achieve a major advancement in nuclear fusion technology?
para_P.body: This question will be answered affirmatively if, by December 31, 2030, any of Elon Musk's enterprises (such as SpaceX, Tesla, Inc., Neuralink, and The Boring Company) have played a role in a major advancement in nuclear fusion technology. A "major advancement" is defined as a development that results in a clear and substantial improvement in nuclear fusion technology, such as achieving net energy gain from a fusion reaction, significantly lowering the cost of fusion energy production, or a significant improvement in fusion reactor design. The advancement must be acknowledged as significant by the scientific community, with validation through publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or an official announcement by a major scientific organization. In the absence of direct publication or announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The contribution by Elon Musk's enterprises must be direct and significant, playing a crucial role in the achievement of the advancement.

P.title: Will a new chemical element related to nuclear technology be discovered by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new chemical element that has applications in nuclear technology is officially discovered and recognized by the scientific community. The discovery must be confirmed through peer-reviewed research published in a reputable scientific journal and acknowledged by a leading authority in the field, such as the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC) or the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA). The element must be identified as having potential or actual applications in nuclear technology, including but not limited to, energy production, radiation shielding, or nuclear medicine. In the event of multiple claims of discovery, the question will resolve as Yes based on the first discovery that meets these criteria and is officially recognized. Discoveries that are later disproven or retracted will not count towards this question's resolution.

para_P.title: Will a novel chemical element pertinent to nuclear technology be identified by 2030?
para_P.body: This question will be answered affirmatively if, by December 31, 2030, a novel chemical element with applications in nuclear technology is officially identified and acknowledged by the scientific community. The identification must be validated through peer-reviewed research published in a reputable scientific journal and recognized by a leading authority in the field, such as the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC) or the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA). The element must be recognized as having potential or actual applications in nuclear technology, including but not limited to, energy production, radiation shielding, or nuclear medicine. In the case of multiple discovery claims, the question will be answered affirmatively based on the first discovery that meets these criteria and is officially acknowledged. Discoveries that are later disproven or retracted will not be considered for this question's resolution.

P.title: Will the development of technology significantly influence the outcome of the 2024 US presidential election?

para_P.title: Will advancements in technology play a crucial role in determining the result of the 2024 US presidential election?

P.title: Will Ukraine's GDP per capita surpass that of Poland before 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, Ukraine's GDP per capita, as reported by the World Bank or another internationally recognized economic organization, surpasses that of Poland for any fiscal year. The GDP per capita should be calculated based on current US dollars for consistency. In the event that the World Bank or the designated authoritative source discontinues its reporting or significantly changes its methodology, an alternative reputable source will be used, following the same criteria for GDP per capita calculation. This question does not consider temporary fluctuations; the GDP per capita must be higher in one fiscal year compared to the previous year's report for Poland.

para_P.title: Will Ukraine's per capita GDP exceed Poland's by 2030?
para_P.body: This question will be answered affirmatively if, before January 1, 2030, Ukraine's per capita GDP, as reported by the World Bank or another internationally recognized economic organization, exceeds that of Poland for any fiscal year. The per capita GDP should be measured in current US dollars for consistency. If the World Bank or the designated authoritative source stops reporting or significantly changes its methodology, an alternative reputable source will be used, adhering to the same criteria for per capita GDP calculation. This question does not account for temporary fluctuations; the per capita GDP must be higher in one fiscal year compared to the previous year's report for Poland.

P.title: Will Germany become a global leader in renewable energy technology by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Germany is recognized as a global leader in renewable energy technology. Recognition must come from at least one of the following authoritative sources: - The International Renewable Energy Agency (IRENA) - The International Energy Agency (IEA) - A major global energy conference or summit, specifically mentioning Germany's leadership in renewable energy technology. Leadership in renewable energy technology is defined by: - The development and deployment of innovative renewable energy technologies surpassing current global standards. - Significant contributions to global renewable energy research and development. - A substantial increase in Germany's renewable energy capacity and production, leading the world in either total capacity or growth rate. In the absence of explicit recognition from the above sources, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming Germany's status as a global leader in renewable energy technology will suffice. Temporary achievements or projects that do not indicate a sustained leadership position do not count towards this question's resolution.

para_P.title: Will Germany be acknowledged as a global leader in renewable energy technology by 2025?
para_P.body: This question will be answered affirmatively if, by December 31, 2025, Germany is acknowledged as a global leader in renewable energy technology. Acknowledgment must come from at least one of the following authoritative sources: - The International Renewable Energy Agency (IRENA) - The International Energy Agency (IEA) - A major global energy conference or summit, specifically highlighting Germany's leadership in renewable energy technology. Leadership in renewable energy technology is defined by: - The creation and implementation of innovative renewable energy technologies that exceed current global standards. - Significant contributions to global renewable energy research and development. - A substantial increase in Germany's renewable energy capacity and production, leading the world in either total capacity or growth rate. In the absence of explicit acknowledgment from the above sources, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming Germany's status as a global leader in renewable energy technology will suffice. Temporary achievements or projects that do not indicate a sustained leadership position do not count towards this question's resolution.

P.title: Will the NFL host a game in a country currently under international sanctions by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the National Football League (NFL) has officially hosted a regular season or playoff game in a country that, at the time of the game, is under international sanctions by the United Nations, the European Union, the United States, or any other major international body. The game must be part of the official NFL season schedule, and not a pre-season or exhibition game. Confirmation must come from an official NFL announcement or credible news reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., ESPN, BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post). In the event that sanctions are lifted on a country after the announcement of the game but before the game itself, the question will still resolve as Yes if the sanctions were in place at the time of the announcement. Temporary or partial sanctions specifically targeting individuals or entities within the country do not qualify; the sanctions must be country-wide.

para_P.title: Will the NFL hold a game in a nation facing international sanctions by 2025?
para_P.body: This question will be answered affirmatively if, by December 31, 2025, the National Football League (NFL) has officially held a regular season or playoff game in a nation that, at the time of the game, is subject to international sanctions by the United Nations, the European Union, the United States, or any other major international body. The game must be part of the official NFL season schedule, excluding pre-season or exhibition games. Verification must come from an official NFL announcement or credible news reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., ESPN, BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post). If sanctions are lifted on a nation after the announcement of the game but before the game itself, the question will still be answered affirmatively if the sanctions were in place at the time of the announcement. Temporary or partial sanctions specifically targeting individuals or entities within the nation do not qualify; the sanctions must be country-wide.

P.title: Will China become the leading country in quantum computing research impacting the natural sciences by 2030?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, China is recognized as the leading country in quantum computing research with significant impacts on the natural sciences. Leading status can be determined by:
- The number of peer-reviewed scientific publications in quantum computing by Chinese researchers or institutions, compared to those from other countries.
- The establishment or operation of quantum computing facilities that are recognized as the most advanced in terms of computational capabilities or scientific breakthroughs.
- Recognition by international scientific organizations or panels as the leader in quantum computing research impacting the natural sciences.

Significant impact on the natural sciences must be evidenced by groundbreaking research findings or technological advancements in fields such as physics, chemistry, biology, and earth sciences, directly attributed to Chinese quantum computing research.

In the absence of clear international recognition, a consensus among reputable scientific publications (e.g., Nature, Science, IEEE Transactions on Quantum Engineering) and news outlets (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, Science Daily) will be considered sufficient.

para_P.title: Will China dominate quantum computing research with significant impacts on the natural sciences by 2030?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered affirmatively if, by December 31, 2030, China is acknowledged as the foremost nation in quantum computing research with notable effects on the natural sciences. Dominance can be assessed by:
- The volume of peer-reviewed scientific papers in quantum computing authored by Chinese researchers or institutions, in comparison to those from other nations.
- The creation or operation of quantum computing facilities that are deemed the most advanced in terms of computational power or scientific achievements.
- Recognition by global scientific organizations or panels as the leader in quantum computing research affecting the natural sciences.

Notable impact on the natural sciences must be demonstrated by pioneering research discoveries or technological innovations in disciplines such as physics, chemistry, biology, and earth sciences, directly linked to Chinese quantum computing research.

In the absence of explicit international recognition, a consensus among esteemed scientific journals (e.g., Nature, Science, IEEE Transactions on Quantum Engineering) and media outlets (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, Science Daily) will be deemed adequate.

P.title: Will the Bureau of Labor Statistics report a significant shift in employment within the renewable energy sector by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) reports a significant shift in employment within the renewable energy sector in the United States. A "significant shift" is defined as an increase or decrease of at least 10% in the total number of employed individuals in the sector compared to the previous year's report. The renewable energy sector includes industries and jobs directly involved in the production, installation, and maintenance of renewable energy sources such as solar, wind, hydroelectric, geothermal, and biomass energy. The BLS's Annual Report on Occupational Employment and Wages will be the authoritative source for this determination. In the absence of a clear report from the BLS, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The New York Times) will be considered sufficient. Temporary fluctuations due to seasonal hiring or short-term projects do not count towards this question's resolution.

para_P.title: Will the Bureau of Labor Statistics announce a notable change in employment in the renewable energy sector by 2025?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) announces a notable change in employment within the renewable energy sector in the United States. A "notable change" is defined as an increase or decrease of at least 10% in the total number of employed individuals in the sector compared to the previous year's report. The renewable energy sector includes industries and jobs directly involved in the production, installation, and maintenance of renewable energy sources such as solar, wind, hydroelectric, geothermal, and biomass energy. The BLS's Annual Report on Occupational Employment and Wages will be the definitive source for this determination. In the absence of a clear report from the BLS, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The New York Times) will be considered sufficient. Temporary fluctuations due to seasonal hiring or short-term projects do not count towards this question's resolution.

P.title: Will Amazon deploy an AI system capable of fully autonomous warehouse management by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Amazon has officially deployed an AI system capable of fully autonomous warehouse management across any of its warehouse facilities. The system must be capable of operating without human intervention for tasks including but not limited to inventory management, order processing, packaging, and shipping. The deployment of such a system must be confirmed by an official Amazon announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The system must be operational, not in a trial phase. In the event of a partial deployment (e.g., limited to specific warehouses), the question will resolve as Yes if the system is intended for nationwide or global expansion. Temporary deployments for specific events or the use of similar technology in private spaces do not count towards this question's resolution.

para_P.title: Will Amazon implement a fully autonomous AI system for warehouse management by the end of 2025?
para_P.body: This question will be answered affirmatively if, by December 31, 2025, Amazon has officially implemented an AI system that can manage warehouse operations autonomously in any of its facilities. The system must handle tasks such as inventory management, order processing, packaging, and shipping without human intervention. Confirmation must come from an official Amazon announcement or documentation. If there is no public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will suffice. The system must be fully operational and not in a trial phase. If the deployment is partial (e.g., limited to specific warehouses), the question will be answered affirmatively if the system is intended for nationwide or global rollout. Temporary deployments for specific events or the use of similar technology in private spaces are not considered for this question's resolution.

P.title: Will a major cryptocurrency platform introduce a health and wellness rewards program regulated by the Food and Drug Administration by 2025?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major cryptocurrency platform has officially introduced a health and wellness rewards program that is regulated by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA).

A "major cryptocurrency platform" is defined as a platform with at least 1 million active users worldwide. The health and wellness rewards program must offer incentives, such as discounts or cryptocurrency rewards, for activities or purchases that promote health and wellness, as defined by the FDA.

The introduction of the program must be confirmed by an official announcement from the cryptocurrency platform and documentation of FDA regulation. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post) will be sufficient for resolution.

The program must be operational and available to users, not in a trial phase. Programs that are limited to specific regions within the U.S. will count towards this question's resolution, provided they are intended for national expansion.

para_P.title: Will a significant cryptocurrency platform launch a health and wellness rewards initiative overseen by the FDA by the end of 2025?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered affirmatively if, by December 31, 2025, a significant cryptocurrency platform has officially launched a health and wellness rewards initiative that is overseen by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA).

A "significant cryptocurrency platform" is defined as a platform with at least 1 million active users globally. The health and wellness rewards initiative must provide incentives, such as discounts or cryptocurrency rewards, for activities or purchases that promote health and wellness, as defined by the FDA.

The launch of the initiative must be confirmed by an official announcement from the cryptocurrency platform and documentation of FDA oversight. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post) will be sufficient for confirmation.

The initiative must be fully operational and accessible to users, not in a trial phase. Initiatives that are limited to specific regions within the U.S. will count towards this question's resolution, provided they are intended for national expansion.

P.title: Will Google achieve carbon neutrality in its global operations by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Google has officially achieved carbon neutrality in its global operations. Carbon neutrality must be verified by an independent, reputable third-party organization recognized for environmental or carbon accounting standards. The achievement must encompass all of Google's operations worldwide, including data centers, offices, and any other facilities. The verification process should confirm that Google has effectively balanced its carbon emissions by reducing them to net zero through a combination of emissions reduction efforts and investment in renewable energy or carbon offset projects. In the absence of a direct announcement from Google, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient to confirm the achievement. Temporary or partial achievements, such as carbon neutrality for a single sector of operations or for a limited time period, do not count towards this question's resolution.

para_P.title: Will Google reach carbon neutrality across all its global operations by 2025?
para_P.body: This question will be answered affirmatively if, by December 31, 2025, Google has officially attained carbon neutrality in all its global operations. The carbon neutrality status must be validated by an independent, reputable third-party organization recognized for environmental or carbon accounting standards. This achievement must cover all of Google's worldwide operations, including data centers, offices, and any other facilities. The verification process should confirm that Google has effectively neutralized its carbon emissions by reducing them to net zero through a combination of emissions reduction efforts and investments in renewable energy or carbon offset projects. In the absence of a direct announcement from Google, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient to confirm the achievement. Temporary or partial achievements, such as carbon neutrality for a single sector of operations or for a limited time period, do not count towards this question's resolution.

P.title: Will FIFA's decision to expand the World Cup lead to a significant increase in global sports betting revenue by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a significant increase in global sports betting revenue attributed to FIFA's decision to expand the World Cup. A "significant increase" is defined as a rise of at least 20% in global sports betting revenue compared to the year prior to the expansion announcement, adjusted for inflation. The assessment of revenue figures must come from credible financial or sports analytics organizations. In the absence of direct attribution to the World Cup expansion, a consensus among at least three reputable financial or sports news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, ESPN, Financial Times) will be required for resolution. The question will resolve as No if these criteria are not met by the specified date.

para_P.title: Will FIFA's choice to enlarge the World Cup result in a notable rise in worldwide sports betting income by 2030?
para_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a notable rise in worldwide sports betting income attributed to FIFA's choice to enlarge the World Cup. A "notable rise" is defined as an increase of at least 20% in worldwide sports betting income compared to the year before the expansion announcement, adjusted for inflation. The assessment of income figures must come from credible financial or sports analytics organizations. In the absence of direct attribution to the World Cup expansion, a consensus among at least three reputable financial or sports news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, ESPN, Financial Times) will be required for resolution. The question will resolve as No if these criteria are not met by the specified date.

P.title: Will a new species of plant or animal be discovered in Virginia that significantly impacts the field of natural sciences by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new species of plant or animal is discovered in Virginia and is recognized by the scientific community as having a significant impact on the field of natural sciences. The discovery must be documented and described in a peer-reviewed scientific journal. The impact is considered significant if it leads to new insights or theories in biology, ecology, conservation, or a related field, and is acknowledged as such by a reputable scientific organization or a consensus of experts in the relevant field. In the event of multiple discoveries, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one discovery meets these criteria. Discoveries made but not recognized within the timeframe do not count towards this question's resolution.

para_P.title: By 2030, will a newly identified species of plant or animal in Virginia have a notable influence on natural sciences?
para_P.body: This question will be answered affirmatively if, by December 31, 2030, a new species of plant or animal is found in Virginia and acknowledged by the scientific community as having a notable influence on natural sciences. The discovery must be recorded and detailed in a peer-reviewed scientific journal. The influence is considered notable if it results in new understandings or theories in biology, ecology, conservation, or a related field, and is recognized as such by a respected scientific organization or a consensus of experts in the relevant field. If multiple discoveries occur, the question will be answered affirmatively if at least one discovery meets these criteria. Discoveries made but not recognized within the timeframe do not count towards this question's resolution.

P.title: Will the Democratic Party (US) implement a policy that significantly influences social sciences research by 2025?

para_P.title: Will the US Democratic Party introduce a policy that has a major impact on social sciences research by 2025?

P.title: Will an NBA player break the single-game scoring record by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, an NBA player breaks the current single-game scoring record of 100 points, set by Wilt Chamberlain on March 2, 1962. The new record must be officially recognized by the National Basketball Association (NBA) and must occur during a regular season or playoff game. Exhibition, pre-season, and All-Star games are excluded. The game in which the record is broken must be completed under the NBA's official rules without any disqualifications that could affect the game's outcome or the record's validity. In the event of a tie, where multiple players break the record in the same game, the question will resolve as Yes. If the record is broken in a game that is later voided or the results are officially altered for any reason by the NBA, the question will not resolve as Yes.

para_P.title: Will an NBA player surpass the single-game scoring record by the end of 2030?
para_P.body: This question will be answered affirmatively if, by December 31, 2030, an NBA player surpasses the existing single-game scoring record of 100 points, established by Wilt Chamberlain on March 2, 1962. The new record must be officially acknowledged by the National Basketball Association (NBA) and must take place during a regular season or playoff game. Exhibition, pre-season, and All-Star games are not included. The game in which the record is surpassed must be completed under the NBA's official rules without any disqualifications that could impact the game's outcome or the record's legitimacy. In the event of a tie, where multiple players surpass the record in the same game, the question will be answered affirmatively. If the record is surpassed in a game that is later voided or the results are officially altered for any reason by the NBA, the question will not be answered affirmatively.

P.title: Will a new vaccine for a major infectious disease be approved by the FDA by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has officially approved a new vaccine for a major infectious disease. A "major infectious disease" is defined as a disease that has caused significant morbidity or mortality in the United States or globally within the last 10 years, as reported by the World Health Organization (WHO) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). The approval must be for a vaccine that has not been previously available in the United States, and it must be intended for widespread use rather than limited to emergency authorization. The resolution will be based on official FDA announcements or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The vaccine must be available for distribution within the United States to count towards this question's resolution.

para_P.title: Will the FDA approve a new vaccine for a significant infectious disease by 2025?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has officially sanctioned a new vaccine for a significant infectious disease. A "significant infectious disease" is defined as one that has caused considerable illness or death in the United States or globally within the past decade, as reported by the World Health Organization (WHO) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). The approval must be for a vaccine that has not been previously available in the United States and is intended for widespread use rather than restricted to emergency authorization. The resolution will be based on official FDA announcements or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The vaccine must be available for distribution within the United States to count towards this question's resolution.

P.title: Will India launch its own digital currency to compete with major cryptocurrencies by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Government of India has officially launched a digital currency designed to compete with major cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin, Ethereum, etc. The launch must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The digital currency must be operational and available for public use, not in a trial phase. The intent to compete with major cryptocurrencies must be explicitly stated by official government sources or inferred from the functionality and design of the digital currency. In the event of a partial launch (e.g., limited to specific regions or for specific applications), the question will resolve as Yes if the digital currency is intended for nationwide use and broader financial integration.

para_P.title: Is India planning to introduce its own digital currency to rival major cryptocurrencies by 2025?
para_P.body: This question will be answered affirmatively if, by December 31, 2025, the Indian Government has officially introduced a digital currency aimed at competing with major cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin, Ethereum, etc. The introduction must be verified by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will suffice. The digital currency must be fully operational and accessible to the public, not in a trial phase. The intention to compete with major cryptocurrencies must be explicitly stated by official government sources or inferred from the digital currency's functionality and design. In the case of a partial launch (e.g., limited to specific regions or specific applications), the question will be answered affirmatively if the digital currency is intended for nationwide use and broader financial integration.

P.title: Will Amazon deploy an AI system capable of fully autonomous warehouse management by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Amazon has officially deployed a system that utilizes artificial intelligence for the full autonomous management of at least one of its warehouse operations. The system must be capable of performing all tasks required for warehouse management without human intervention. These tasks include but are not limited to inventory management, order processing, picking and packing, and shipping logistics. The deployment of such a system must be confirmed by an official Amazon announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The system must be operational, not in a trial phase. In the event of a partial deployment (e.g., limited to specific warehouses), the question will resolve as Yes if the system is intended for expansion to additional warehouses. Temporary deployments or the use of similar technology for specific tasks within the warehouse do not count towards this question's resolution.

para_P.title: Will Amazon introduce an AI-driven system for complete autonomous warehouse management by the end of 2025?
para_P.body: This question will be answered affirmatively if, by December 31, 2025, Amazon has officially introduced a system that employs artificial intelligence for the comprehensive autonomous management of at least one of its warehouse operations. The system must be able to handle all tasks necessary for warehouse management without human involvement. These tasks include, but are not limited to, inventory control, order processing, picking and packing, and shipping logistics. The introduction of such a system must be verified by an official Amazon announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will suffice. The system must be fully operational, not in a trial phase. In the case of a partial deployment (e.g., limited to specific warehouses), the question will be answered affirmatively if the system is intended for expansion to additional warehouses. Temporary deployments or the use of similar technology for specific tasks within the warehouse do not count towards this question's resolution.

P.title: Will the Virginia Department of Health influence a significant change in election health safety protocols before 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the Virginia Department of Health (VDH) has influenced a significant change in election health safety protocols in Virginia. A "significant change" is defined as a new or revised set of guidelines or regulations that materially alter the way elections are conducted in terms of health safety, with the aim of preventing disease transmission during the voting process. This could include, but is not limited to, changes in voting booth sanitation, the implementation of social distancing measures, adjustments to voting times or locations to reduce crowding, or the introduction of mail-in voting or electronic voting options as standard practice. The change must be officially announced by the VDH or a related government body and must be implemented statewide. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient evidence of the VDH's influence on the change. Temporary measures introduced for a single election do not count towards this question's resolution.

para_P.title: Will the Virginia Department of Health bring about a major alteration in election health safety protocols by 2030?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the Virginia Department of Health (VDH) has brought about a major alteration in election health safety protocols in Virginia. A "major alteration" is defined as a new or revised set of guidelines or regulations that significantly change the way elections are conducted in terms of health safety, aiming to prevent disease transmission during the voting process. This could include, but is not limited to, changes in voting booth sanitation, the implementation of social distancing measures, adjustments to voting times or locations to reduce crowding, or the introduction of mail-in voting or electronic voting options as standard practice. The change must be officially announced by the VDH or a related government body and must be implemented statewide. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient evidence of the VDH's influence on the change. Temporary measures introduced for a single election do not count towards this question's resolution.

P.title: Will France implement a nationwide carbon-neutral initiative by 2030?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, France has officially implemented a nationwide initiative that is recognized as carbon-neutral. The initiative must encompass actions across multiple sectors, including but not limited to energy, transportation, industry, and agriculture, aimed at achieving a net-zero carbon footprint for the country.

The initiative must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

For the purpose of this question, "carbon-neutral" means that any carbon emissions produced by France are balanced by an equivalent amount of carbon sequestration or offsetting measures, within the same calendar year. The verification of carbon neutrality must be conducted by an independent, internationally recognized environmental organization.

In the event of partial implementation (e.g., limited to specific regions or sectors), the question will resolve as Yes only if there is a clear, government-confirmed plan for nationwide coverage by the end of 2030.

para_P.title: Will France launch a countrywide carbon-neutral program by 2030?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with Yes if, by December 31, 2030, France has officially launched a countrywide program that is acknowledged as carbon-neutral. The program must include actions across various sectors, such as energy, transportation, industry, and agriculture, aimed at achieving a net-zero carbon footprint for the nation.

The program must be validated by an official government announcement or documentation. If there is no public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will suffice.

For the purpose of this question, "carbon-neutral" means that any carbon emissions produced by France are counterbalanced by an equivalent amount of carbon sequestration or offsetting measures within the same calendar year. The verification of carbon neutrality must be carried out by an independent, internationally recognized environmental organization.

In the case of partial implementation (e.g., limited to specific regions or sectors), the question will be answered with Yes only if there is a clear, government-confirmed plan for nationwide coverage by the end of 2030.

P.title: Will there be a significant breakthrough in the understanding of social physics that influences public policy by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant breakthrough in the field of social physics is announced and has influenced public policy. A "significant breakthrough" is defined as a discovery or development that fundamentally changes the understanding or application of social physics in a way that directly impacts public policy formulation or implementation. The breakthrough must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presented at a major scientific conference. The influence on public policy must be evidenced by the adoption of new policies, significant amendments to existing policies, or the initiation of public policy debates directly attributable to the breakthrough. The adoption or amendment of policies must be confirmed by official government documentation or statements from a recognized authority in the field. In the absence of direct government confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The breakthrough must be recognized by the scientific community, as evidenced by citations in subsequent research or endorsements by recognized experts in the field.

para_P.title: Will a major advancement in social physics that impacts public policy occur by 2030?
para_P.body: This question will be answered affirmatively if, by December 31, 2030, a major advancement in social physics is announced and has an impact on public policy. A "major advancement" is defined as a discovery or development that fundamentally alters the understanding or application of social physics in a manner that directly affects public policy creation or execution. The advancement must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presented at a significant scientific conference. The impact on public policy must be demonstrated by the adoption of new policies, substantial changes to existing policies, or the initiation of public policy debates directly linked to the advancement. The adoption or modification of policies must be verified by official government documentation or statements from a recognized authority in the field. In the absence of direct government confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The advancement must be acknowledged by the scientific community, as evidenced by citations in subsequent research or endorsements by recognized experts in the field.

P.title: Will a major geopolitical event significantly impact international soccer tournaments by 2025?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major geopolitical event has significantly impacted the scheduling, location, participation, or overall execution of international soccer tournaments.

A "major geopolitical event" is defined as an event that involves the government or military actions of one or more countries, leading to widespread international reactions or sanctions. Examples include, but are not limited to, wars, significant diplomatic disputes, economic sanctions, or major political changes.

The impact on soccer tournaments must be confirmed by FIFA or UEFA through official announcements or documentation. In the absence of such announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The question will resolve as No if no such events or impacts are confirmed by the resolution date.

para_P.title: Will a significant geopolitical event notably affect global soccer competitions by 2025?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a significant geopolitical event has notably affected the scheduling, location, participation, or overall execution of global soccer competitions.

A "significant geopolitical event" is defined as an event involving the government or military actions of one or more countries, resulting in widespread international reactions or sanctions. Examples include, but are not limited to, wars, major diplomatic disputes, economic sanctions, or substantial political changes.

The impact on soccer competitions must be confirmed by FIFA or UEFA through official announcements or documentation. In the absence of such announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The question will be answered with No if no such events or impacts are confirmed by the resolution date.

P.title: Will FIFA introduce a global health initiative to combat pandemics affecting international sports events by 2025?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, FIFA has officially announced and initiated a global health initiative aimed at combating pandemics that affect international sports events. The initiative must be designed to prevent, manage, or mitigate the impact of pandemics on the organization and execution of international sports events, including but not limited to football matches and tournaments.

The announcement of such an initiative must be confirmed through official FIFA communication channels, such as press releases, official statements, or documented meetings. In the absence of direct communication, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient evidence.

The initiative must include specific measures or programs that are actionable and measurable, and it must be aimed at a global scale, not limited to specific regions or countries. Temporary measures or initiatives solely for specific events do not count towards this question's resolution.

para_P.title: Will FIFA launch a worldwide health program to address pandemics impacting international sports by 2025?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with Yes if, by December 31, 2025, FIFA has officially declared and started a worldwide health program focused on addressing pandemics that impact international sports events. The program must be intended to prevent, manage, or lessen the effects of pandemics on the organization and execution of international sports events, including but not limited to football matches and tournaments.

The declaration of such a program must be verified through official FIFA communication channels, such as press releases, official statements, or documented meetings. In the absence of direct communication, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient evidence.

The program must include specific measures or initiatives that are actionable and measurable, and it must be aimed at a global scale, not restricted to specific regions or countries. Temporary measures or initiatives solely for specific events do not count towards this question's resolution.
